description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aafoo","text":"Brief instructions on how to use the AMAS Package to concatenate sequences in the command line. Especially useful if your SequenceMatrix is no longer compatible with your version of Java.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2cmhv","text":"Prerequisites: Python 3 previously installed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqdg1","text":"Download the AMAS package here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fbn4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aesn3","text":"Once downloaded, drag the AMAS folder into your Applications folder. You will need the path to this folder in order to proceed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":1120,"link":"https://pypi.org/project/amas/","name":"AMAS","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"repository":"https://pypi.org/project/amas/#files","version":"1.0","developer":"Borowiec, M.L. 2016. AMAS: a fast tool for alignment manipulation and computing of summary statistics. PeerJ 4:e1660.","can_edit":0,"guid":"49F8AA53341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ncei","text":"Use the command line to navigate to the folder containing your aligned files (one alignment per gene). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5rnr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"886lp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":53,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aqomu","text":"Make sure the names for each terminal (sequence) are IDENTICAL for every gene, or the concatenation will not work.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ep860","text":"Use the concat command to concatenate your files: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i0p","text":"-i indicates the input files you want to concatenate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g8fb","text":"gene1.fas is your first aligned gene file (drag the file to the terminal to automatically include the path to it)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lrg0","text":"gene2.fas is your second aligned gene file (drag the file to the terminal to automatically include the path to it)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fqju","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"673dk","text":"-f indicates the format of your files (in this case fasta, but you can also use nexus, phylip, etc)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q8nq","text":"-d indicates the data type (DNA in most cases, use aa for amino acids)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ht9u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"470av","text":"This will generate two files:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djc62","text":"\"concatenated.out\" is your concatenated file. Add the file extension \".fas\" so you can open it in AliView or Mesquite to check that it worked (recommend AliView if you're staying in FASTA format).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3ea6","text":"\"partitions.txt\" lists the partitions for your new concatenated file","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"561on","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2m3j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ohvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":122,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8i7cp","text":"Note: There are two genes listed here, but you can add as many as you want. Simply separate the paths/filenames by spaces.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"command_name":"","description":null,"guid":"47BBCEE2341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","name":"python3 /Applications/amas-1.0/amas/AMAS.py concat -i gene1.fas gene2.fas -f fasta -d dna","os_name":null,"os_version":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":329,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"8qae1","text":"Recommendation: rename your output and partitions files so that they are specific to the current analysis you're running and/or match the input file names (e.g. if you're running a 6-gene concatenated analysis based on mafft aligned files on July 12, try something like \"6mftCCT_Jul12_out.fas\" and \"6mftCCT_Jul12_partitions.txt\").","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p4tv","text":"You can specify the format of the partitions file, depending on the program you want to use. For RAxML: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lg06","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6l1f6","text":"If you open the partitions file, you can check that it is properly formatted. For RAxML, it should look something like this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jngf","text":"DNA, 16S = 1-605 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uv1m","text":"DNA, COX1 = 606-1200 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avd69","text":"DNA, 28S = 1201-1800","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"command_name":"","description":null,"guid":"47BBCF9D341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","name":"python3 /Applications/amas-1.0/amas/AMAS.py concat -f fasta -d dna -i gene1.fas gene2.fas -u phylip --part-format raxml","os_name":null,"os_version":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4aav7","text":"If you would like to change the output format (something other than FASTA) use the argument -u, as in:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p3g1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"64auq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"command_name":"","description":null,"guid":"47BBCF56341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","name":"python3 /Applications/amas-1.0/amas/AMAS.py concat -i gene1.fas gene2.fas -f fasta -d dna -u phylip","os_name":null,"os_version":null}}}}

title: AMAS  to Concatenate Sequences
